channel.title: Editing java bytecode
channel.description: Is it possible to just edit the java bytecode to change one line in the class? When I decompile it, it gives me loads of errors obviously, so I'm looking for a way to change one line within the class in order to get it back up and running. Any guidance?

item.title: Editing java bytecode
item.dc:creator: @ohokay ohokay
item.description:
@ohokay wrote:

imthenull:

Of course, some popular bytecode libraries are BCEL, and Asm (easier to use, and up to date). Bytecode manipulation is generally easy to do if you understand it. I would recommend you read the Java Virtual Machine specification, but if that’s too much to read, at least check out the class file format here. This article by an IBM employee goes into further detail about bytecode. It’s worth it to read all of the aforementioned links. Understanding bytecode is inevitable if you wish to pursue any serious relations with java.

Thanks I’ll look into it.

Read full topic
